docs.snippet: There is hard evidence of the damage that tanning beds can do, especially when people are exposed at a young age. Too many young people aren’t getting the message....
docs.abstract: Editorial warns that young people are continuing to use indoor tanning beds at alarmingly high rates, despite numerous studies linking the practice to skin cancer; expresses support for bill that would bar all children under 18 from using tanning facilities in New York.
docs.lead_paragraph: There is hard evidence of the damage that tanning beds can do, especially when people are exposed at a young age. Too many young people aren’t getting the message.

docs.snippet: Rafael Nadal beat Novak Djokovic, 7-5, 6-3, in a rain-delayed final in Rome to win his record sixth Italian Open and regain the No. 2 ranking....
docs.abstract: Rafael Nadal defeats Novak Djokovic in rain-delayed final to win his record sixth Italian Open and regain the No. 2 ranking.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rafael Nadal beat Novak Djokovic, 7-5, 6-3, in a rain-delayed final in Rome to win his record sixth Italian Open and regain the No. 2 ranking.

headline.print_headline: Late for School After a Long Journey for a Drop to Drink
headline.seo: Niger Children Miss School to Search for Water
headline.main: Late for School After a Long Journey for a Drop to Drink

docs.snippet: In drought-racked Niger, the difficult search for water frequently falls to children as young as 10, and they often arrive late to school, or not at all....
docs.abstract: Zinder Journal; drought is a major impediment to education in Niger, where the job of securing water frequently is given to children as young as 10; in rural districts around Zinder, Niger's second-largest city, search for water keeps one third to one-half of students out of school; children must often trek for miles to draw water from wells, both in the morning and at night, which prevents them from attending school on time, if at all.
docs.lead_paragraph: In drought-racked Niger, the difficult search for water frequently falls to children as young as 10, and they often arrive late to school, or not at all.

headline.print_headline: Facing Criticism, Obama Defends Ads Attacking Romney’s Record at Bain Capital
headline.seo: Obama Defends Attacks on Romney’s Record at Bain
headline.main: Facing Criticism, Obama Defends Ads Attacking Romney’s Record at Bain Capital

docs.snippet: President Obama argued the focus of the ad was fair, saying Mitt Romney was making his claim on the presidency based on his experience in private equity....
docs.abstract: Pres Obama defends his campaign's aggressive attacks on Bain Capital, arguing that Mitt Romney's years at the helm of a private equity firm are worthy of a serious debate.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Chicago, and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama argued the focus of the ad was fair, saying Mitt Romney was making his claim on the presidency based on his experience in private equity.

docs.snippet: Brian McNamee, Roger Clemens’s former trainer, testified Monday that he helped Andy Pettitte, Chuck Knoblauch and Mike Stanton acquire performance-enhancing drugs....

docs.lead_paragraph: Brian McNamee, Roger Clemens’s former trainer, testified Monday that he helped Andy Pettitte, Chuck Knoblauch and Mike Stanton acquire performance-enhancing drugs.

headline.print_headline: New York Delays Primary by 2 Days
headline.seo: Citing Sept. 11 Anniversary, New York Delays State Primary
headline.main: New York Delays Primary by 2 Days

docs.snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed legislation that would move the election to Sept. 13 from Sept. 11, a day lawmakers have said should not be about politics....
docs.abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo signs legislation that moves the state and local primary election to Sept 13 from Sept 11; says September 11 is a day for reflection and not for politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed legislation that would move the election to Sept. 13 from Sept. 11, a day lawmakers have said should not be about politics.

headline.seo: Bob Boozer, Former N.B.A. and Olympic Player, Dies at 75
headline.main: Bob Boozer, a 1960 Olympian, Is Dead at 75

docs.snippet: A member of the gold-medal-winning United States basketball team and a two-time all-American at Kansas State, Boozer went on to play 11 seasons in the N.B.A....
docs.abstract: Bob Boozer, a member of the dominating 1960 United States Olympic basketball team who went on to star in the National Basketball Association for 11 seasons, dies at age 75.
docs.lead_paragraph: A member of the gold-medal-winning United States basketball team and a two-time all-American at Kansas State, Boozer went on to play 11 seasons in the N.B.A.

headline.print_headline: ABC Requires Tether for Niagara Falls Walk
headline.seo: For Niagara Falls Walk, ABC Tells Wallenda He Must Wear Harness
headline.main: ABC Requires Tether for Niagara Falls Walk

docs.snippet: Nik Wallenda said he was prepared to wear a harness when walking over Niagara Falls but would rather not....
docs.abstract: Circus performer Nik Wallenda says he is preparing to wear a harness, although he would rather not, during his walk on a steel cable over Niagara Falls, precaution demanded by ABC network, which will broadcast the event; Wallenda say he views wearing a harness as a violation of his family's history of untethered wire-walking.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nik Wallenda said he was prepared to wear a harness when walking over Niagara Falls but would rather not.

docs.snippet: With too few women in office, maybe wives should seize the advantage that sons and daughters do....
docs.abstract: Frank Bruni Op-Ed column observes that the wives of politicians are increasingly able to transition into political office themselves; cites Christie Vilsack, wife of Agriculture Sec Tom Vilsack who is mounting a stiff challenge against Rep Steve King in the Iowa Congressional race.
docs.lead_paragraph: With too few women in office, maybe wives should seize the advantage that sons and daughters do.

headline.print_headline: Mauritania: Qaddafi’s Former Spy Chief Is Indicted
headline.main: Mauritania: Qaddafi’s Former Spy Chief Is Indicted

docs.snippet: Abdullah al-Senussi, who ran Libya’s extensive spy network, was indicted Monday for “illegally entering Mauritania using false identity documents,” a judicial official said....

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Abdullah al-Senussi, man who ran Libya's extensive spy network under Col Muammar el-Qaddafi, is indicted in Mauritania for illegally entering the country with false documents; Senussi is wanted by the International Criminal Court, as well as by France and Libya.
docs.lead_paragraph: Abdullah al-Senussi, who ran Libya’s extensive spy network, was indicted Monday for “illegally entering Mauritania using false identity documents,” a judicial official said.
